questions.text: Do you have any numbness in the area where you would sit on a saddle (between your legs, around your private parts)?

options.label: Yes, I can't pee even though I feel like I need to
Yes, I'm leaking pee without meaning to
Yes, I can't control my bowels
Yes, both bladder and bowel problems

questions.text: Do you have a fever or feel feverish?
Have you lost weight without trying in the past few months?

options.label: Yes, and I'm still being treated or it might be back
Yes, but it was treated in the past

questions.text: Have you used any injected (IV) drugs recently?
Does the pain wake you up at night?

red_flag_combinations.message: Numbness in the saddle area with bladder or bowel problems could be cauda equina syndrome. This is a surgical emergency that needs to be seen immediately.
Leg weakness with pain going down both legs may mean serious nerve compression. This needs urgent evaluation.
Back pain with fever and IV drug use raises concern for a spinal infection. This needs urgent medical attention.
Severe back pain with fever could be a spinal infection. This needs urgent evaluation.
New back pain in someone with a history of cancer, especially pain that wakes you at night, needs urgent evaluation to check for cancer spread.
Back pain with weight loss and a cancer history is concerning for metastatic disease. This needs prompt imaging.
Back pain with weakness after a fall or accident could mean a spinal injury. Keep still and get emergency help.
New bladder or bowel control problems with back pain need urgent medical evaluation.
Trouble lifting your foot (foot drop) suggests significant nerve damage. This needs urgent evaluation.
